text: The ultraviolet (UV) response of mammalian cells is characterized by a rapid and selective increase in gene expression mediated by AP-1 and NF-kappa B.
text_with_entity_marker: The ultraviolet (UV) response of mammalian cells is characterized by a rapid and selective increase in gene expression mediated by [E1]AP-1[/E1] and [E2]NF-kappa B[/E2].

text: The effect on AP-1 transcriptional activity results, in part, from enhanced phosphorylation of the c-Jun NH2-terminal activation domain.

text: Here, we describe the molecular cloning and characterization of JNK1, a distant relative of the MAP kinase group that is activated by dual phosphorylation at Thr and Tyr during the UV response.
text_with_entity_marker: Here, we describe the molecular cloning and characterization of [E1]JNK1[/E1], a distant relative of the [E2]MAP kinase[/E2] group that is activated by dual phosphorylation at Thr and Tyr during the UV response.

text: Significantly, Ha-Ras partially activates JNK1 and potentiates the activation caused by UV.
